page.title: 04Lamberhurst Primary School
page.content: {The Church of England Primary {School}is sited towards the top of School Hill to the north of the village centre. It opened in{1836}thanks to the foresight of the vicar Robert Hawkins, William Moreland of Court Lodge and Edward Hussey of Scotney Castle. A few years later the second storey, Dutch Gables and impressive{clock tower}were added. This two-faced clock keeps the village informed of each passing hour. The spiral stone staircase is trodden weekly by the blacksmith from the next door{forge}to re-wind the weights. The weather vein above was also made at the forge. The new infants school was added in 1894. Today the 94, 5 to 11 year olds, enjoy the old building with its modern improvements, which include indoor toilets and a{swimming pool.
